ingredients: 3/4 cup cottage cheese or farmer's cheese (tvorog)
2 tbsp butter or oil for frying
Optional: honey or jam for serving
instructions: Place cottage cheese in a bowl, mash with a fork
Add egg, sugar, salt, and vanilla, mix well
Add 2 tbsp flour, mix until combined
Optional: add raisins or dried cranberries
The dough should be slightly sticky but manageable
Place 1/4 cup flour in a shallow plate for coating
Take about 1 tbsp of dough, form into a small patty
Dredge both sides in flour, shake off excess
Repeat with remaining dough
Heat butter or oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat
Fry syrniki in batches for 3-4 minutes per side until golden brown
Don't crowd the pan - cook 2-3 at a time
Transfer to paper towels to drain excess oil
Serve warm with sour cream, honey, or fresh berries
Can be served for breakfast or dessert

ingredients: 1/2 cup mixed nuts (almonds, walnuts, cashews, pecans)
1/2 cup mixed dried fruits (raisins, cranberries, apricots, dates)
Optional: dark chocolate chips or chunks
Optional: pumpkin seeds or sunflower seeds
Optional: cinnamon or cardamom for seasoning
instructions: Choose raw or roasted nuts according to preference
If nuts are raw, toast them in a dry pan for 3-5 minutes until fragrant
Let nuts cool completely
Chop large dried fruits (apricots, dates) into bite-sized pieces
Combine nuts and dried fruits in a bowl
Optional: add dark chocolate chips for extra indulgence
Optional: add pumpkin or sunflower seeds for variety
Optional: sprinkle with cinnamon or cardamom
Store in airtight container for up to 2 weeks
Portion into snack-sized bags for easy grabbing

recipe.title: Chicken soup with vegetables
instructions: Prepare ingredients according to standard cooking methods
Cook until done
Season to taste
Serve hot

recipe.title: Rice noodles with egg
instructions: Prepare ingredients according to standard cooking methods
Cook until done
Season to taste
Serve hot

ingredients: Optional: 1 tbsp white sesame seeds for topping
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper
In a large bowl, beat softened butter and sugar until light and fluffy
Add egg yolk and vanilla extract, mix well
Sift together flour, matcha powder, and salt
Gradually add dry ingredients to wet ingredients, mixing until just combined
Form dough into a log, wrap in plastic, and refrigerate for 30 minutes
Slice dough into 1/4 inch rounds
Optional: roll edges in sesame seeds or sprinkle with sugar
Place cookies on baking sheet, 2 inches apart
Bake for 10-12 minutes until edges are lightly golden
Cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes, then transfer to wire rack
Store in airtight container for up to 1 week
Mix beef mince with soy sauce, sesame oil, brown sugar and garlic. Marinate for 30 minutes
Mix all bibimbap sauce ingredients in a bowl, set aside
Cook spinach: blanch in boiling water for 30 seconds, drain, squeeze out excess water, season with a little sesame oil and salt
Cook bean sprouts: boil in water for 5 minutes, drain, season with sesame oil and salt
Julienne carrots, stir-fry with oil and 1/6 tsp salt for 2-3 minutes
Slice shiitake mushrooms, stir-fry with oil and 1/6 tsp salt for 2-3 minutes
Fry eggs sunny-side up or to your preference
Cook marinated beef in wok over medium-high heat for 3-5 minutes until browned
Place steamed rice in bowls, arrange beef, vegetables, and egg on top
Garnish with seasoned seaweed
Serve with bibimbap sauce on the side
Mix everything together before eating
recipe.source: My Korean Kitchen - Authentic Korean Recipe

recipe.title: Congee with egg and scallions
instructions: Prepare ingredients according to standard cooking methods
Cook until done
Season to taste
Serve hot

ingredients: 2 apples (any variety - Granny Smith, Honeycrisp, Fuji)
4 oz (120g) cheese (cheddar, gouda, brie, or your favorite)
instructions: Wash apples thoroughly
Core apples and slice into wedges or rounds
Slice cheese into thin pieces or small cubes
Arrange apple slices on a serving plate or board
Place cheese alongside or on top of apple slices
Optional: drizzle with honey
Optional: sprinkle with chopped nuts and cinnamon
Serve immediately for best freshness

ingredients: 1/2 lb (225g) beef sirloin or tenderloin, cut into strips
instructions: Season beef strips with salt and pepper
Heat 1/2 tbsp oil in a large skillet over high heat, brown beef in batches, set aside
Add butter and remaining oil to the same pan
Sauté onion for 3-4 minutes until softened
Add mushrooms, cook 5-7 minutes until browned
Add garlic, cook 30 seconds until fragrant
Sprinkle flour over vegetables, stir for 1 minute
Optional: add white wine and let it reduce for 1 minute
Add beef broth, tomato paste, and Worcestershire sauce
Simmer for 5 minutes until sauce thickens
Reduce heat to low, stir in sour cream and Dijon mustard
Add beef back to pan, heat through (do not boil after adding sour cream)
Season with salt and pepper to taste
Serve over cooked rice, garnish with fresh parsley

ingredients: 1/8 cup cheese, shredded (cheddar, feta, or your choice)
instructions: Crack eggs into a bowl, add milk or cream, whisk until well combined
Heat butter in a non-stick pan over medium heat
Add onion and bell pepper, sauté for 2-3 minutes until softened
Add mushrooms, cook 2 more minutes
Add spinach, cook until just wilted (30 seconds)
Pour egg mixture over vegetables
Gently push eggs across pan with a spatula, letting uncooked egg flow underneath
Continue cooking, stirring gently, until eggs are set but still creamy (about 2-3 minutes)
Remove from heat while slightly undercooked (they'll continue cooking)
Fold in shredded cheese
Garnish with fresh herbs if desired
Serve immediately while hot

ingredients: 2 cups Greek yogurt or plain yogurt
instructions: Spoon yogurt into serving bowls
Drizzle honey generously over the yogurt
Add vanilla extract and cinnamon if using, stir gently
Top with fresh berries
Optional: add granola for crunch
Optional: sprinkle with chopped nuts
Optional: garnish with fresh mint
Serve immediately
For meal prep: layer ingredients in jars, refrigerate for up to 3 days

ingredients: 1 tbsp tomato paste or 1/2 cup tomato juice
Optional: 1/4 cup cooked beef or sausage
instructions: Heat butter or oil in a large pot over medium heat
Sauté onion until softened, 5 minutes
Add carrot, cook 3 more minutes
Add garlic, cook 30 seconds
Add tomato paste, cook 1 minute
Add broth, beets, potato, and sugar
Bring to a boil, reduce heat, simmer 20 minutes
Add cabbage and vinegar, cook 10 more minutes until vegetables are tender
Optional: add cooked beef or sausage
Ladle into bowls
Top with a generous dollop of sour cream
Garnish with fresh dill
Serve hot with crusty bread

breakfast.name: Buckwheat porridge with milk and berries

ingredients: 1 cup milk (dairy, almond, or oat milk)
1 cup fresh or frozen berries (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries)
Optional: nuts or seeds for topping
instructions: Rinse buckwheat groats thoroughly until water runs clear
In a medium pot, bring water and salt to a boil
Add buckwheat, reduce heat to low, cover
Simmer for 15-20 minutes until water is absorbed
Remove from heat, let stand covered for 5 minutes
Fluff with a fork
Stir in butter and milk until creamy
Add honey or maple syrup to taste
Optional: add cinnamon or vanilla
Top with fresh or frozen berries
Optional: add nuts or seeds
Serve warm

ingredients: 4 slices traditional Russian or Eastern European rye bread
3-4 tbsp butter (salted or unsalted to taste)
instructions: Slice rye bread into thick or thin slices according to preference
Bring butter to room temperature for easy spreading
Generously spread butter over each slice
Optional: sprinkle with coarse salt
Optional: rub warm bread with a cut garlic clove for extra flavor
Optional: garnish with fresh dill
Optional: serve with radish slices or cucumber on the side
Can be served as a simple breakfast, snack, or side dish
Best served at room temperature or lightly toasted

ingredients: 1/2 cup sour cream or crème fraîche
instructions: Freeze cabbage head for 2-3 days, then thaw overnight in fridge
Cook rice in boiling water for 5 minutes (al dente), drain
Sauté onion in olive oil until tender, 7-10 minutes
Mix beef, pork, parsley, onions, carrots, rice, salt and pepper
Mix sauce ingredients in a bowl, set aside
Remove cabbage leaves from head, cut thick ribs
Place 2 tbsp filling at wide end of leaf, fold sides in and roll up
Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C)
Pour some sauce on bottom of casserole dish
Layer cabbage rolls, adding bay leaves and sauce halfway
Pour remaining sauce over rolls, cover
Bake for 1.5-2 hours until tender
Serve with extra sour cream if desired

ingredients: 4 slices crusty bread (rye, sourdough or whole grain)
Optional: garlic cloves for rubbing bread
instructions: Heat butter or oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat
Crack eggs into pan, being careful not to break yolks
Season with salt and pepper
Cook until whites are set but yolks are still runny, 3-4 minutes
For over-easy, carefully flip and cook 30 more seconds
Toast bread until golden and crispy
Optional: rub warm bread with cut garlic clove
Place eggs on toast, garnish with fresh herbs if desired
Serve immediately while eggs are hot

ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, daikon, cucumber, cauliflower)
instructions: Cut vegetables into sticks or bite-sized pieces
In a saucepan, combine vinegar, water, sugar and salt
Bring to a simmer, stirring until sugar dissolves
Let the pickling liquid cool completely
Place vegetables, garlic, ginger, and chilies in clean glass jars
Pour cooled liquid over vegetables to cover completely
Add fresh herbs if desired
Seal jars and refrigerate for at least 24 hours
Vegetables will keep for 2-3 weeks refrigerated
Serve cold as a snack or side dish

ingredients: 1/2 block (7 oz) firm or extra firm tofu, cubed
1/2 tbsp cornstarch mixed with 1 tbsp water
1/2 tsp Sichuan peppercorns, toasted and ground
instructions: Cut tofu into 1-inch cubes
Bring water to boil, add tofu and blanch for 2 minutes to remove moisture
Drain and set aside
Heat oil in wok or large pan over medium heat
Add ground pork, cook until browned, break up any clumps
Add chili bean paste, fermented black beans, garlic, and ginger
Stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until fragrant
Add soy sauce, sugar, and chicken stock
Bring to a simmer
Add tofu cubes, gently stir to combine
Simmer for 5 minutes, letting tofu absorb flavors
Stir in cornstarch mixture to thicken sauce
Add dried red chilies and ground Sichuan peppercorns
Cook 1-2 more minutes
Garnish with sliced green onions
Serve hot over steamed rice

ingredients: 1.5 cups cooked rice, preferably day-old and cold
Optional: protein of choice (chicken, shrimp, tofu)
instructions: Heat wok or large pan over high heat with 1/2 tbsp oil
Add beaten eggs, scramble quickly until just set, remove from pan and set aside
Add remaining oil to pan over high heat
Add garlic, stir-fry for 15 seconds until fragrant
Add carrots, peas, and corn, stir-fry for 2-3 minutes
Add cold rice, breaking up any clumps with spatula
Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes, pressing rice against pan to get crispy edges
Return eggs to pan, add soy sauce and oyster sauce
Toss everything together for 1-2 minutes until well combined
Remove from heat, add white pepper and sesame oil
Garnish with green onions and cilantro if desired
Serve hot

ingredients: Optional: 1/2 tsp chili paste (sriracha or gochujang)
instructions: Press tofu to remove excess water: wrap in paper towels, place a heavy object on top for 15-20 minutes
Cut pressed tofu into 1-inch cubes
Pat cubes dry with paper towels
Place cornstarch in a shallow bowl, season with salt and pepper
Lightly coat tofu cubes in cornstarch, shake off excess
Heat vegetable oil in a large pan or wok over medium-high heat
Add tofu cubes in a single layer (don't crowd pan)
Fry for 3-4 minutes per side until golden and crispy
Remove tofu from pan and set aside
Reduce heat to medium, add sesame oil
Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry for 30 seconds
Optional: add chili paste or oyster sauce
Return tofu to pan, toss gently to coat
Add green onions, toss for 30 seconds
Garnish with toasted sesame seeds if desired
Serve hot as a snack or side dish

ingredients: 60g beef tenderloin per bowl, very thinly sliced
instructions: Char onion and ginger over high heat until blackened on cut sides
Toast spices (star anise, cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, coriander) in dry pan for 3 minutes
Rinse bones and brisket, cover with water, boil for 5 minutes, then drain and rinse
Bring 1.2 litres water to boil, add bones, brisket, charred onion and ginger, and toasted spices
Simmer covered for 3 hours
Remove brisket (it should be fall-apart tender), cool, then refrigerate for later use
Simmer remaining broth uncovered for 40 more minutes
Strain broth into another pot, discard bones and spices
Add fish sauce, adjust with sugar and salt if needed
Cook rice noodles according to package instructions
Place noodles in bowls, top with raw beef slices and brisket slices
Ladle hot broth over beef (it will cook to medium rare)
Serve with toppings on the side
